function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of understanding of psychological distance and its impact on contagious disease propagation","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of construal levels leading to misaligned disease control strategies","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider psychological distance in communication and public health messaging","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential tourists perceiving risks relative to the covid-19 outbreak","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of psychological distance and construal level theory on tourism behavior","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Negative impact on the research context due to misinterpretation of psychological distance and perceived risk","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Losses in international tourism receipts","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The spread of covid-19 is associated with the number of trains, population flow, and percentage of the aging population.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The coefficients with local effects have both negative and positive estimates, indicating a mixed association with covid-19 spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Dependent variable is infection ratio","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of gwr and mlr models for comparison","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for spatial autocorrelation in disease spread analysis","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of global and local effects in the mixed gwr model","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of spatial connection and analysis tools may result in inaccurate identification of activity centers.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Travel time by public transport to activity centers may impact the spread of epidemics within cities.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Link between national outbreak of covid-19 and air travel in ireland","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data on actual transport demand","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of population flow data captured via mobile phone cellular signaling","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of inter-city connections on the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scientifically sound data on spatial-temporal activity-travel behavior and its association with covid-19 spread","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Costly and time-consuming nature of diary surveys for capturing activity-travel behavior","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of studies on the impact of transportation flows and population density on disease spread","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher population density being a significant predictor of infection rates","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relationships between virus viability, population density, and indoor spaces","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Traffic volumes and travel distance as factors for covid-19 transmission","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the direct and indirect face-to-face communication reflected by the built environment be .","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risks associated with international attention on epidemic analysis, policy measures, and global development based on responses in china.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of multi-sectoral collaboration in designing healthier cities","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global spread of viruses like zika and chikungunya across 73 countries and leading to public health emergencies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Globalization and increased international travel enabling the importation of invasive mosquito vectors and pathogens","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temperature modifications influencing the epidemic potential of mosquito-borne diseases","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Climate change leading to increased health burden","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of impacts of climate change","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impacts of climate change on human health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear guidelines for pressure differentials and air changes per hour","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient analysis or prediction of virus transmission risks at an architectural scale","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on post-evaluation of known outbreak cases for understanding virus transmission risks","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of viruses due to human interaction and movement","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and visualization of virus contamination in the built environment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate visualization of virus transmission behaviors and impacts","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of longitudinal overview in 3d situated visualization","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Effects of randomness in human behaviors not adequately addressed","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex simulation parameters overwhelming non-expert users","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitation in intuitive comparison of multiple simulation outputs","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incorporating relationships between occupants’ behaviors and virus transmission","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on existing data may lead to overestimation of simulation validity and not account for behavioral influences.","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of detailed exploration of human-building interactions in simulation tools.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Embedding contextual information in 3d building models may lead to inaccurate simulation of occupant behaviors and interactions.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of trust in virtual human agency and simulated human behaviors may result in skepticism and resistance to using the system for evaluating designs.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in manually adjusting behavior-generating parameters for simulations with many occupants may lead to inefficiency and potential errors.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"}]}
